lines.name: ANNOUNCER
lines.text: Come on. Fresh off the plane from New York City: Ashley Johnson! (cheering)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Whoa! I'm a monstah! (cheering and chanting "Monster")

lines.name: ANNOUNCER
lines.text: Next up is Travis's better half: Laura Bailey! (cheering and chanting "Vex")

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is amazing! What?!

lines.name: ANNOUNCER
lines.text: Your favorite druid: Marisha Ray! (cheering and chanting "Keyleth")

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: ANNOUNCER
lines.text: All right, the man who brings it all to life with his amazing imagination: Matthew Mercer! (cheering and chanting "DM")

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we sit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have four episodes already out for that, if you haven't seen it yet. The fifth one comes out this week on Monday on Nerdist. And this will be introducing Brian Posehn's character; he'll finally be joining the campaign for that, and some crazy shit goes down, so don't miss it. Yeah, and I think we have one other cool announcement, if you guys want to take this one.

lines.name: ANNOUNCER
lines.text: So Chris, you want to tell them about it?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: ANNOUNCER
lines.text: So you can look for that Q1 2017?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Spring?

lines.name: ANNOUNCER
lines.text: Spring 2017. All right, well, I think that's it, so let's get started. Enjoy the show, everyone! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So before you guys press anywhere forward, is there any preparation you want to take on your adventure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Straight-up prep? Oh jeez.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you hear us? Yes? Are there any potion stores nearby? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an investigation check. No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! You strongly recall information that inform you that the last bastion of true civilization is long past you, south of where you originally came from.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, just stretch up. Active squats.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask a question? Since I was obviously out of commission with the whole last fight that happened--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your own fault, Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not! I was being a politician. Is anybody hurt? Do we need to heal anybody before we go? Did these fireflies mess with any of you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think everyone's mostly fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think you were the only one who got the shitty end of that deal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's fucked up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will say that Vax looks a little weird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax is just strange.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I swear it's me!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was a little fast, I think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Garmelie, at this point, watching this whole circumstance, walks up to you and goes, "It's good to see you again. I don't know where you went away last time, but I hope "you enjoyed the last sketch I did. If you need any more, let me know. I got plenty of paper."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. What was that? Who were you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look down and see the small faun who you previously had commissioned to draw--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. I really love that piece that you did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, thank you kindly."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're so welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me know. Your form's closer to mine, so it's easy for me to get a full view." (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Snap. So are we going across the river, then?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, there's a river?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First roll of the night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But that's a couple of miles off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But the rapids are right there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see them maybe half a mile in front of you. And you can see the spray occasionally shooting off some of the rocks, and the shore of the river just barely shows the speed of the water passing by.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's definitely not something we can wade across, I'm assuming.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could fashion a crude canoe and go down it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to take my staff, and I want to feel how deep it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you decide to walk the half-mile to make it to the river?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a lot going on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's walk the half-mile. It's a half-mile!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it looks like a long river?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a series of long rivers that completely wrap around the Shademirk. One side of it seems to be vanishing into the Green Sea, which you could barely see to the far seaward side of you, and it curves around the outside of the Shademirk and vanishes into the horizon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a river.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a big river.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It looks like a river, at the very least. Don't trust anything in the Feywild!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I perception and see if there are any sort of creatures that are visible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In layman's terms: west to east.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How far in does it take to cross all of these little rivers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rivers change in width. The smallest one you can see is maybe ten feet across. Some of them swell to upwards of 30, 40 feet, depending at which point you come across it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the speed and roughness of the ten-foot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all pretty matching in speed, and they're pretty hefty. You can see there are occasional rocks in the edges of water that are just spraying, causing the water to smash into the side and split off around it. There's nothing visible in the water drifting, through. Most of it is destroyed in the process of crashing against the rocks in the sides of the bank.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's find a nice mix of not-too-wide and not-too-rapidy. Not too fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And do what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And start thinking of a way across it and making sure that it's not magical or strange.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could we fly?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Brother, do you want to scout up ahead? Maybe fly up above the river and see down into the oily land? Both of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fine, I'll go ahead and give it a look, I suppose. Although you can fly any time you want, "if you wish."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I can. And I do. I pick my broom up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seemingly ducks down into the grasses that you guys are standing in and vanishes, barely giving a small path as he disappears.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I float above him on the broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Occasionally, you see him glance up and loudly grumble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You are so hidden right now. I can barely even see you. So hidden.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate the backup, sister." And he keeps continuing forward. As you get to the edge of the water itself, he looks inside. It's pretty clear, the water, as you can see the bottom of it right there. You can see a deep-set blanket of greenish-brown algae-type plant life that cakes the bottom of the river floor, the occasional stone protruding from it and everything is growing and pushed around it. He releases his raven wings from his armor, which shoot out in a large 15-foot wingspan on each side. He jumps in the air, makes his way over the first short river, and lands on the other side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to land on the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Glance over. His wings fold behind him and he's like, "Was it so hard, sister? Really?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You wasted your entire hour of flying for that? (laughter and applause)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I got a Vax sigh. I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He scoots underneath your broom, as you're hovering on, and one of his wings catches the edge of it, flicks, and then tries to knock you off your broom. Make a quick strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A what check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strength, my dear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you just killed me--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take one point of damage from the impact; nothing huge. But as you roll to the side, your broom scatters across the stones and dips partially into the river, which begins carrying it slowly--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! And I crawl over and grab it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You grab it and pull it out. As you turn back over, your brother's sitting there with his arms crossed, his wings still folded, smiling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I swing around and hit him with the broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is not with your bow, by the way. This is just adding your proficiency bonus. You're not even proficient. This is an improvised weapon, so you have disadvantage. Go ahead and roll again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was so much better than the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not proficient, really, in attacking with brooms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? With but an instant of reaction time, it passes a good solid foot and a half in front of his face. His wings furl. A couple of feathers dangle down, and he turns around and decides to hop over the next bit of the river.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hate you sometimes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know, sister." As he takes off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, I get on my broom and fly after him, like a loser.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any of you guys also doing anything, or are you just watching them scouting ahead?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're just watching them fly around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you scoot up to catch up to your brother, he's probably a good 15 feet ahead of you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay, we're back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was such a busy desktop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you hop up after him, you notice his wings go into a dive, and he ends up curving downward at an alarming rate, diving right into the river.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I float down and try to grab him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A wisdom saving throw? Shit, balls, mother-- that's bad: nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as you see your brother dive into the water, you begin to coast downward. As you do, there's an impulse in your head that begins pushing and steering the broom lower, lower. And even in the back of your head, you sense this is bad; we're going far too steep. It's like you're outside of your physical body. The control has alleviated itself, and your body forces you to splash into the river, as well, both of you guys submerging yourself in the raging rapids. You guys see this in the distance, with a splash of two impacts on the riverside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we tell them to go fishing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think we did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we try to get out? Can we try to get out of the water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, let's go save our friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a ten-foot river for you guys to traverse first, before you get to them. Each of you who are trying to leap across, make an athletics check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't say I was trying to leap across.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I said anyone who wants to try.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to hop on the-- (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't follow. I'll jump on. All right, Grog's got two gnomes on his back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course he does; that's perfect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Help. Right here. Are we underwater, or are we on top of the water? We're just dying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two gnomes on Grog's back. You grab both of them, do a quick sprint and leap, as heavy as you can. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rolled a 25.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. That's way better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike and Scanlan, you're a little jostled from the impact.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was so fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I landed on my keys!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I rolled a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The people who are in the water, are they being dragged under? We can just not see them anymore?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you take a moment to watch--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Percy? Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'm fine. I'm just wet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he being carried away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The three who've been pulled under the river-- that includes you, Vex'ahlia, Vax'ildan, and Percy-- I need you to make a constitution check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Constitution?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why does everything here hate us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh! Oh Jesus! Six.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're going to die live.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why am I rolling so bad right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. Okay, you manage to pull yourself up to the surface and you almost get to the point of actually getting some air, and a force pulls you back under.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, Percy, you do maintain the breath in your lungs. You and your brother both (coughs) give away a bulk of the air, and you feel yourself in the beginning spasms of drowning.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I cast Grasping Vine from the side of the river and try to catch myself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what? Yes, you can. In the aspects of this sequence though, it is a difficult job to cast this. Is it a concentration check or not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grasping Vine is a bonus action, yo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But is it a concentration spell? That is the difference.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have my card because we're traveling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, how far are they from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From you guys out there, they're maybe 25 feet from you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. No, it is. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all right. So I need you to roll another constitution check, if you could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm scared of all my dice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's because you have a hundred of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's good! 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (applause)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's my broom that I'm holding up in my hand right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So the river doesn't hate magic?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's my brother? Where's Vax?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Control Water. Where do I see Percy? Is Percy and Vax together?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, Vax is in the next river over. Percy is about maybe 20 feet from you, but is quickly being rushed down the river.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vax is? Or Percy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so first, I'm going to Control Water. I'm going to stop the flow of current and see if I can get it to burp out Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Just pat it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to burp the river.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is Keyleth. She's making a wisdom check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, okay. Yeah. Wait, what? Just a straight wisdom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just spent a lot of money on these dice today!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. Hold on. I've got this. Quick, everyone. What's that over there? There.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, a 15.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it a one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You did?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your brother, not doing so hot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I send the vine to him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, before we get to that, the three of you guys now get to act.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I sing to myself: (singing) Scanlan Shorthalt. I'm a gnome. My name is Scanlan Shorthalt. I'm a gnome. There's a million chicks I haven't boned, but just you wait--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fine, you go and take your inspiration die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then I will cast Bigby's Hand. Bigby's Hand! Because we're in a symphony hall. And I'm going to grab Vax and toss him out of the river.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, taking Bigby's Hand. I need you to make a strength check for Bigby's Hand, if you could.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does he get? What does Bigby get? I'm going. It's a different guy. He's a whole guy, who's not quite as handsome as me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Add a plus eight to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. You watch as Bigby's Hand plunges into the river itself, vanishes for a few moments, and then like a reverse cannonball out of the water, coming curving around and at an incredible speed, looks like it's about to spike Vax onto the water's edge before slowing down and limply dropping him on the edge of the bank front.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I give him a little pat on the head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (coughing and panting) "No flight."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grab Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grab Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I'll say it is your turn, because he move quite a bit down the river, but you have a pretty high movement rate as a barbarian, so you tie the chain around yourself at your full movement speed, and you get to the very edge of the bank and begin to wade in just as you pull the jar over your head. And that's going to be the end of your action there. Pike, you're holding him at the edge. I need you to make a strength check, if you could.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I got you, buddy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Monstah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh wait. Hold on. Where did it go? I'm sorry, I forgot how to play.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe it's a plus four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. Without an issue, you watch as this giant anchor of a man is being held solid by this tiny rock of a gnomish cleric.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Go get him, Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (muffled) Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as her teeth bite down, and her tongue sticks out the edge as she digs her feet into the bottom of the river rock. Percy, you see a dark form in the river as you're rushing past. I need you to make a perception check with disadvantage, as you're being drawn underwater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perception check with disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a perception check with disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not that bad. Where's my perception? There it is: 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14, okay. Just as you see this strange dark form appear out of the way, you instinctively sweep your hand out, and you smack and catch the edge of Grog's pants.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He has pants? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems the longer you're in the river, the stronger it's getting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit. Pike! Pull! I got him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to roll another strength check, Pike, as you pull them in. There is a little more weight on there, so the DC's going to be a little higher. Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I quickly inspire her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. I turn to her and I sing: (singing) Repairing up your heart when she heals you! And when you are a bard, you feel it, too! And no matter what you do, she heals the pain, and she's pretty, too!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love you for doing *NSYNC.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten-sider!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She did a ten-sider.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's taking it now, so roll a strength check and add.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, it's the same. Or is that this way?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good. That's better!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With my dice?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. I originally rolled a two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog and Percy, you feel yourselves being brought deeper into the center of the river.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I try again with the current? It's a concentration spell up to ten minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you do. So coming back to Keyleth, at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even the water's angry! (screams)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, I'd like you to make another wisdom check, if you could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll good!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, that's better. Straight wisdom? A saving throw or just a check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys, we defeated a creek.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We didn't actually even defeat it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's like 50 more creeks in front of us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me and Vax are on one side, and everyone else is on the other, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. There are a couple of small trees that are planted or grown up between the river banks, and you can still hear the rapids rushing past.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many more rivers would we have to cross?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking ahead of you, there's probably 12.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's just go home. Fuck it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was very clever with the pot, by the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right? I figured if anything was going to hit me in the head, it would hit the jug first.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was less clever, but still very impressive. What if we were to throw your chain, or if we could throw the rope across the river?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, I'm going to use my earring so I don't have to shout.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, no, that's better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like when I was crossing the river, I wanted to kill myself. And I'm afraid that anybody else crossing the river--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, Vax has already crossed. We're not going to feel the angst coming off of him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The experience, when you were trying to cross over, was reminiscent of that urge to jump whenever you're near the edge. That weird, very base impulse whenever you get to a point of danger that says, do it! It's like that being triggered and preyed upon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a river of impulses? Such an allegory for so many things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here's a thought. We take the rope, we tie ourselves to it, we toss it over to the two of you, we start using it to wade, you help pull us over. Everybody would have to be terrible for everything to go. Everybody will be fighting together to get across.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We can attach the rope to the Immovable Rod. Just put it in the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I have it. I thought Grog had it, but I think I might have picked it up after.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As long as we're tied together, we can only go so far. It'll be like mountain climbing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But that just gets us across one, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think they're across two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How wide's the second river between us and Vax?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would take you guys about 20 feet across.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good. 20 feet across.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, there's ten more rivers!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's so many rivers!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we become mist form? Are our minds affected when we're mist form?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. I'm sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it? Are we?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't learn mist form today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking hell.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What if we made a boat and then floated down the river?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're rapids.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That sounds like a terrible idea, by the look of his face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like all the rivers are connected?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like some of them swell between each other and then split off again. Some are solitary, from your current position that you can see, but you only have what's immediately near you to really see. Since some of these are hills, and it carves into part of these hills, you don't have a complete view of how they intertwine and merge beyond the immediate hillsides.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Garmelie!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, where's he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's back on the other side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Some help, please?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you heard any stories about how people crossed these damn rivers before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I haven't actually been here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! So tell me what you've heard!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's dangerous, and it keeps the Shademirk from spreading!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Garmelie! Hop in the river!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Has my minute of Hand worn off yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's getting towards the end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 25 again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Arcing overhead. (distant scream, impact) A little plume of dust.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did he make it? How far did he get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a long, awkward pause as you see no movement.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god. I think I just killed him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, you're such a dick!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a little harsh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's fine!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's doing great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan, Keyleth, if I had magic, I would freeze all the water, so go ahead and do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm going to try and halt the flow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a wisdom check, if you could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, you stupid opal dice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that a natural 20?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's another fucking one! Useless!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Put it away, Keyleth. Put it away for the rest of the night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I spent so much money on these!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've got to retire that bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cackles)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Put it in its dice jail.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: See? Better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy! Don't touch my dice, Percy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's where the actual tension comes from. There is something living, like an entity that these rivers seem to almost mingle as.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there a bunch of trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few sporadic trees scattered around, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How tall are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not that tall. Some are maybe 15, 20 feet up. These trees specifically are a little more marsh-based. They're not quite swamp-based trees, but that's as tall as they get.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the river's 20 feet wide, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, these are maybe five feet wide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Five feet. We could jump across them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, the rivers. Sorry. The trees are five feet wide. I misunderstood. Yes, the actual rivers are between ten to 20 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have Tree Stride?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do, but I can only cast that on myself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought we could all use it, always?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can use mist form. Sorry. There's Teleport Via Plants, which I did not bring today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did you bring today?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I brought Control Water, Grog!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. The total distance from us to the end of the 12th river is how far?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably close to 150 feet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can do that in five minutes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I can make it with Pike super fast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dimension Door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. But the rest of you are fucked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! This is really good! This is good, because with the Immovable Rod--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Set it and forget it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then you teleport back to the other side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How's that going to work?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait. If we Dimension Door, what if you turn into an animal to fly, and then you have a broom, and someone can ride on your broom?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could potentially turn us into animals that can swim, which is why I was wondering if the rivers were connected. Maybe we can jump like salmon, going upstream?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't tell Trinket!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket is safe in this necklace right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you raise earth? Can you make a dam?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can, and I did bring Move Earth, as well as Wall of Stone. To be totally honest, I am terrified of messing with the ground. I'm afraid if I move the earth, it will eat me. It will split open and swallow me. I could try it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, did I hear right that these rivers are alive? What did I hear?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're magical rivers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to chop down a tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to chop down a tree? Grog, Keyleth picked a flower and the entire world ended.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are getting nowhere, super fast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You shoot one end of the rope to him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, why didn't I think of that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything's easy peasy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why didn't we think of that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Give me the rod. You take the eternal string or whatever it's called.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have the eternal string, and I have the rod.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I walk over to a tree just in case their plan fails? I want to start chopping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go up to one of the nearby trees at the edge, and you can see across the way, it looks like there's part of a crumpled stone corner, some long dilapidated ruin. You can see what looks to be one dried tree log that has fallen over and rotting on the other side. But there is one tree right on the edge of the bank that you guys are on that leads across this next river that is pretty solid looking. Maybe four feet in thickness there and 25 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't do it, Grog! Do not do it yet!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hope your stupid plan works!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Grog. Remember when we almost died because I picked a flower? Just throwing it out there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm super bored, so do your plan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to start tying the rope to an arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're tying the rope to an arrow. Okay. You have, at this point, a good seven minutes left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Are you going to teleport, and then we're going to try to do that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, let's do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you teleport first. I'll shoot the arrow, see if I can actually get it to stick over there, and then you can do the...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Pike, you with me? Hand in hand?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hand in hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here we go. I Dimension Door us across the river, if it works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys grasp hands, both of them vanish in a swirl of purplish-pink smoke. You see, simultaneously, across all the banks, right at the edge of the Shademirk, this little burst of energy. You guys land on the ground immediately, your feet sinking about three inches into this black sludge-like tar material. Already, you can smell the outskirts of the Shademirk. It's a very sulfurous decay smell that permeates the ground by you, and you can see it seeping into the river like a slow-moving morass of syrup, and the water carries it away upstream, like an angry force of cleaning. It's a little sludgy where you stand, but you guys are across.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Hey! Shoot an arrow at me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, I shoot an arrow! Not directly at him, but pretty close to him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a long shot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a really long-- I'm just going to shoot a couple arrows just to be sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I instinctively cover my neck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. What did you roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You fire the arrow. It goes a little wide while you're aiming in the proximity of Scanlan and arc off and staples to one of the outside trees, sticking in it. The rope goes lax and begins to be carried in the water, and you can see the tension as the river itself seems to be trying to pull the rope underneath the rapids.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hold the other side of the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you begin pulling it up, and it's hard to pull up. The actual river is almost pulling the rope under itself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I grab it, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. I need both of you guys to make strength checks together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I try and stop the current once again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the range on Control Water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 300 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah you can do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Calm, waters, calm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And hook it to the Immovable Rod there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah! I forgot that whole part of the plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can't use it anymore. You're not allowed to use that dice anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just throw it offstage. Just throw it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am not giving you all that dice! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Say it. What was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm assuming it's a low roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a fucking one! For the third time in a row!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so what did you guys roll for your strength checks?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, for strength checks I rolled...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As there has been no druidic aid, unfortunately, in this particular moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, do you know any sailor's knots?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I sure do!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you tie a sailor knot around this Immovable Rod?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I sure can!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which one?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the two of you rush over the 30 feet to the tree that the rope is stapled to right now, it's taut and you can see it's starting to break the arrow as the strength of the rope being pulled into the river.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy, what did you roll for strength?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not that strong!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We are so weak!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We are doing so great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, you catch the actual rope on the other side before the arrow snaps and carries it back by the strength of their pull. So you take it and you make a little knot. Tie it strong from your experience as a sailor to the Immovable Rod, and it is solid and in place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I tie the rope to myself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we should each tie the rope to all of us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, you're on the end there with the rope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope. I'm going to cut down this fucking tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, fine. I'll help.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to tie a rope to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Around me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You get a rope!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We all get ropes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You should be in front, and then the rest of us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay, sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't forget Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Vax, of course. Obviously, my brother, who is standing right here very stealthily.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're all tying yourselves like a daisy chain?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, like you do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Once you've all affixed it, what is the order in which you guys are affixed? I'm just curious!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be in the front.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's Grog, then Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vax, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then leave a little slack for Garmelie at the end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right, because we've got to pick him up on the way through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's in between the two of you guys right now. He's waiting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't worry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good!" He looks over his shoulder at Scanlan and goes, "Good." All right, you guys all begin to pull yourselves forward on the rope, taking your time to make sure that if anything bad happens, you take a moment to pause and help out your friends. I need everyone who's on the edge of that rope to make a general athletics check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody holding on to the rope?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody who's currently tied onto the rope, so not the gnomes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's acceptable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we in any kind of favored terrain right now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only for Aquaman is this favored terrain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to say no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, cool. 11 there, with the dice and the adding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's 20. What did you get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22, okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Making a comeback!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You only have three more minutes on your spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Runny eyeliner, like it's 2001.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You manage to make it across the next six or so rivers. You get to where Garmelie is, who's sitting there tapping his little hoof impatiently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tie yourself on, there, Garmelie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks up at the rope, which is basically head level. "Give me some slack!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (grunts)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You bring yourself over to the eighth, the ninth river finally traversed. A few other scary moments. Keyleth, I want you to make a wisdom check again to see if you can aid this next length.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck you, no. It's a 19! Total 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Harnessing the inspiration of frustration at your recent failures to control the elements that you've been so hoping to learn to bring to your beck and call, you look forward at what would be the third-to-last river in your progress forward, and angrily do this with your hands. You guys watch as the river, like a paper, is torn asunder, the water held at bay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're great! Run!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you start to reach the other side of the bank, Grog, your heavy foot hits something that seems to react to the impact of your weight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a thing? Like a person?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys make your way up the edge of the river. As you glance over the side, you see something in the mud vanish beneath.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I stepped on a catfish.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's eat it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get up and out. Up and out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys all get across, the water slams back, continuing to flow with the river. Angrily, it roars and seems to almost swell up over the bank where it once was before it slowly descends back to its natural rushing rapids.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a really big catfish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's one right before you, and then the one that separates you from Scanlan and Pike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they multiplying? Oh no, it's because we got them wet!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were roughly 12 ahead of you when you asked. You guys have now traversed nine of them, ten of them, so there's only two left at this point. Keyleth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I believe in you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't mean to do that. I was really nervous. But it's an 18, so 25. You know what, Percy? So I'm going to talk. I'm going to be like: Look, river. I'm your friend. I don't want any tension between us. I'm just trying to make it across you, you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see it building up and backing up behind you as the river here comes to a soft, cool dip that you guys can begin to walk through as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good river. Good boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I keep an eye out for whatever I stepped on in the river?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe that hits your armor class.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That'll hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Getting ready for the first real attack damage of tonight's episode.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How come we never noticed the battle map has a river on it? Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the sheer force of the impact pushes him forward and carries him onto the other side of the river, in doing so, dragging all of you behind him at a rapid pace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're across!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most of you go flying in an arc at the sheer force of this impact. I need you guys to make acrobatics checks to try to stop yourselves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not a catfish!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Acrobatics or athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Acrobatics.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's my jam. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, where are we? Where are the gnomes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are way over here on the edge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Wait, where are we? I don't see us at all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, we have to go back!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To the future!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If I recall, it was Grog...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, Percy. Thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Garmelie was in the middle somewhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think he was between me and Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Garmelie was between the two of you guys, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was Vax, Garmelie, Vex, Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't say that. That's not cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get to see a little behind the field there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's so nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pikey pants, what should we do? We should go help them, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, this mud is nice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But I did roll shit initiative, as usual.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There he is. There's Garmelie. Great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am embarrassed by my initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My initiative is really bad, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So top of the round, we have initiative of 25 to 20?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 20. Shut up, really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go, Keyleth!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think that's ever happened before. That's never happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 to 15, anyone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 15 to ten?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is our first live initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, because it didn't happen last time!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all going to die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan and Pike, what did you guys get?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a big fat six.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got a four!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gnomes bringing up the rear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She was teaching me the swirley-whirley while this was all going on.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's exactly what was happening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Keyleth, you're up first. You watch as this giant mass of a creature is now clutching Grog in its jaws, and you see its tail begin to whip up, and it's now guarding itself on all sides as the roots are dragging themselves into the earth around you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it has roots. It appears to be plant-based?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Elements of it. As you get a closer look now, you can see parts of its scaly hide emerge into leaf-like protrusions. It is a strange mixture of both giant croc and some sort of a plant-based entity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to go a little risky here. I'm going to cast Speak With Plants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look at Mercer's face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dumb idea, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's thinking an alligator voice is going to hurt a lot. That's what he's thinking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a perfect Keyleth moment. So Speak With Plants generally works with

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure, but he appears to be fellow kin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's got roots, yo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He does. However, in the purposes of this type of circumstance, it's usually meant for smaller plants that have no sentience that you can normally interact with, like roses and petunias.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've done this before with talking to the treant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm saying, issuing commands on this might be a little more difficult for the rest of the spells.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if I cast at a higher level? Would that help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is not a spell that can be cast at a higher level, unfortunately. So what do you want to do? You're casting Speak With Plants.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't know where that's been! And trust me, I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Don't do it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No way. There's no fucking way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In a way, it doubled in its level.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You do not touch that dice anymore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you shout this out, pointing at the large crocodile-like entity, you look deep into its beady black and purple eye that darts around in the sunken socket of its crocodile skull, and you can see it re-initiate its clutch on Grog, readjusting, pulling him even further into the jaw. Grog, you suffer another nine points of piercing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another nine points of piercing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine points!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, you haven't raged yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, Keyleth. Are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where am I? Oh, I see where I am. Can I move towards that tree, away from the river that also wants to eat us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. You get that far before the rope on your midsection stops you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, we're all tied together!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, yeah. All right. Cool. Done. Go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, your turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Where did he bite me, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has you in his jaws by the midsection, and he's trying to turn you so you lose your footing, and you're getting pretty close right now. So he has you clamped right around your hip and chest right now. The nostril's right here, and the other half of the jaw is almost completely wrapped around the side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go into a frenzied rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I use my bloodaxe, and I'm going to start whacking him in his stupid plant monster face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you use your bonus action to go into the rage, and you have two attacks, so go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, kill him, Grog. Kill him!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For the second one, it's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That also does hit, yes. Roll damage for both of those strikes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So the first one is a 19, plus five points of necrotic damage for 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, 24 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's 15, plus another five points of necrotic damage for 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're jamming it into the side. You can see part of its jaw split open from the impact, and you can see a gleaming of white, slick bone beneath that begins to expose from where you slammed the sharp end of the axe into it twice in a row. It's (snarling) shaking you in its grasp once more.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've always wanted to be a dog toy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Uh. I feel like we're learning a lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you told many people that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next is the croc's turn. At the beginning of its turn, you watch as the wound you just left begins to slowly seal shut. You watch the roots protruding from its body begin to suck the water, moisture, and life force from the land around it, and it begins to heal itself slowly. So some of that damage goes away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Goes away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It begins to heal itself, healing from the ground it's rooted into.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I probably should have tried to break the grapple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would've been a smart move.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't hit anything in forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog. 24. I believe that hits?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as the crocodile backs this way slightly, which allows Vax and Garmelie to get an attack of opportunity. Vax does hit. Well, no, it could be sneak attack, although Grog technically right now is not threatening it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I am. I'm hitting it with a thing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Garmelie is standing next to him, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll let it. Sure. The timing is pretty close on this, and you'll hear why in a second.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven more crocs appear.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm about to get jacked up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31 points of damage from Vax. Garmelie misses. He is awesome. So as it pulls away, you guys watch as the crocodile spins around in the direction of you guys, grabs and tugs Grog, throwing him up into the air. In doing so, all of you guys get pulled this way, and Keyleth dragged behind at that point. The jaws open, and Grog vanishes down the creature's gullet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're all still tied to him!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all attached to him, though!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all got dragged right to the edge of its mouth, so right now, Percy, you have the rope right at the edge of its giant snapping jaws.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're a big set of anal beads.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can he roll for gag reflex? There's a rope coming out of his throat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway. Grog, you're currently blinded and restrained.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Blinded and restrained?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Things go to darkness. You now have a general idea of what Scanlan and Vax went through, oh but a few days ago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Hello, darkness, my old friend!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool. Yeah, you are completely locked inside of it right there. It also spins around as it does so, and its tail (whiplash) whips out, and you see at the very tip of its tail what looks to be some sort of strange, jagged stinger. This is going to whip around in the direction of you, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be only a 14.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good. It misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is now your turn, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me? Okay. I am going to send Trinket out and attack it with Bestial Fury.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket appears at the side of it suddenly, spawning out of this strange burst of shadow energy from the center of your necklace. (roars)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, attack the thing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket happily does so. He has advantage on both of these strikes. Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use my dagger that's on me to try to cut the rope that is attached to my front?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would have to pull a dagger out, and that would be a bonus action. So you can do that now, but you wouldn't be able to cut it until next turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Well, I'll attack with Trinket, and I'll pull my dagger out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, that's good. Wow, I never attack with him. How about that. 26!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So does he do the bite attack, or does he do the claw attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say the first one will be the bite, and then the claw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so now he's rolling for claws. Okay, so that's a 25 for the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit. Roll damage for each.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Oh Jesus, I'm so stupid! Okay, that's eight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight damage, all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then, for the next one he gets two claws, and he's going to use his fours. Jeez Louise. Five plus seven is 13. No, 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 20 points of damage as Trinket tears into the side of this giant gator-like creature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good! And then I cast Hunter's Mark!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull your dagger out, you're like, Hunter's-- damn it. But yeah, at the beginning of your next turn, trying to hack away at that rope; that's fine. That ends your turn, Vex, unless you want to try and move.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I try to fly up in the air? It won't do anything. I'm stuck on the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, yes. And you don't have your broom at the ready.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, so I'll stay where I am, I guess. I'll continue to be flung around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Well done. Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh boy. A lot of my plans got swallowed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (muffled) Help me!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to pull out the Retort pistol, because Bad News will not be happy at this range. First thing I'm going to do is I'm going to take a head shot. I'm going to try and blind him for the round. This is going to go great!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Laura just quit the show.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She couldn't do it anymore.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: See, I'm too nervous to even take Sharpshooter, so we're just going to do this clean. And I roll a natural 20. Fuck it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't even try it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The trick is not to care. It's good enough. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that does hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I throw my bonus in there really quick?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's children in the audience.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They watch the show; they've heard me say worse. Can I sneak Hex in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say given the fact that you said specifically that you were too nervous to do Sharpshooter, you're also too nervous to remember your Hex, but you can finish your turn with that, if you'd like.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Technically not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll let you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a bonus action. I'll do whatever you say. I'm not going to fight you. I'm trying to find my d10s. Okay, here we are. So that's 11 points of piercing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Marking that down. What's the save DC on that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The save DC is a 19 on a constitution save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 12, so yes, it is currently blinded.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not blinded. It has disadvantage on attacks until my next turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. And you are Hexing it, you said?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now I'm Hexing. I'm going to give him a disadvantage on strength checks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Strength or constitution? I'm not asking. Why am I asking people? Asking is for quitters. Still at disadvantage because of the close proximity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is his mouth open?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mouth is currently slightly open.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I close enough to start laying in a few shots inside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Maybe. You can certainly try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to lay in a couple shots inside. Two more shots inside with Hex attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hide behind his uvula, Grog!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so that's a jam, and one to try and fix it really quickly, just trying to give it a clear, with not disadvantage, because it doesn't matter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll as the jam?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You rolled a natural one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Roll damage, anyway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll damage, anyway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hate you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Without the Hex damage bonus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's ten points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you take ten points of piercing damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't have a jam?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it does jam.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so I'm going to do a clear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you go to fire, it splinters off, and there's a burst of smoke and the heat hurts your finger, and you hear this dull (impact) on the inside and a (grunt).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's halved, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's halved, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One more shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have to clear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hit 16 plus--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah, so you manage to get it cleared and get it back and ready to go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't have a third shot, but now I'm at least reloaded. Do I need another round to reload, or does that count as a reload, a clear? I can never remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Using it as an attack is a reload.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so I'll have to next turn. Okay, I'll just call that clear. The last thing I'm going to do is I'm going to move away from the crocodile with all my strength, and I'm going to say: everybody pull! And I'm backing up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be so sad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we assist?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to use an action on your next turn to assist with this, then yes, that'll be your action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might be fine. Oh god.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on, Percy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have the worst strength. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's delightful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We technically have our hands free and are tied to the rope, so in theory we could still use our hands and just try and all shift backwards like stupid people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's going to stay where he is out of range. He's going to try and throw his daggers from where he is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on, brother!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is not going to use his haste boots, though; he's going to save that for later. That's two attacks; both hit. So with the first strike and with the offhand throw. The first one with sneak attack, because it is currently next to Percy. You are threatening it at the moment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hope I have its attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28 points of damage, and the second strike for a total of nine. So after Vax throws both daggers, both sink into the sides of the giant crocodile. It moves ever so slightly with the first impact, the second one seemingly to no effect. Both daggers appear in a puff of smoke to the side of his belt and he looks to you and goes, "Sister, what are we going to do?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He can't really move at that point. It is now Garmelie's turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Garmelie!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Garmelie, who can't turn invisible, who can't use his normal tactics, is just, "Um!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sing a song, Garmelie! Charm him! Do something!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay! How far are we from the disgusting thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are over here, so I'd say, from what you can gauge here, you're approximately 40 feet from it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 40 feet? Great. So I'm going to get a little bit closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go right up to the edge of the water, toes dipping in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to use my trusty old friend Guiding Bolt. I'm going to Guiding Bolt his face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course you are.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And I'm going to do it at 5th-level, because my best friend is in his belly!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, I'm standing right next to you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spell attack bonus. Roll a d20.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Roll a d20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20, add your spell attack bonus, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no. That's terrible. 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 just hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many d6s?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She needs two more d6s.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have two more. Here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 8d6 points of radiant damage, and it is currently marked for an advantage on the next attack against it, as a giant bright light now bursts across the front of its head, causing its eyes to retract and close in pain. (snarling)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on. Big money, no whammies!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's math happening.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's really hard to count up here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So exciting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. Not too shabby. 24 points of radiant damage, and the glowing divine beacon now flashing in the center of its face, causing it to close its eyes. The next person that wants to make an attack is going to have a nice little bonus. Is that the end of your turn? You're going to stay right there at the edge of the river?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Help me!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, you're all the way over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I inspire anyone over there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're within 60 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I will take out my Wand of Magic Missiles and fire many of them. I think if I use six charges, that's eight darts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a lot of missiles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Before you have a moment to really react, the word leaving your voice, "What?" They streak back down, slamming into each side of the rope, causing it to burst into frayed, burnt rope chunks and pieces of twine, all hanging loosely to your sides. All of you guys are now free to move about as you wish.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And for my movement, I will grab Pike around the waist and pull us back five feet off the edge of the pond there. Thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! You have advantage on the next hit on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anybody. Whoever has the next attack roll against it has advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am going to cast 5th-level Blight on him. He is a plant creature! I get how much extra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage and the spell deals maximum damage to it. So what's the spell DC of this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's the big roll, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. You can come look at it if you want to.

lines.name: AUDIENCE
lines.text: Disadvantage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I understand. (chuckles) 15. This is going to suck. So that is 64 points of necrotic damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I said, spit him out! That is caca! Spit it out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What else would you like to do for your turn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to move and flank him a little bit if I can. Get on his six. The other way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you move past to this side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good. Closer, a little bit, to him. One more closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, closer's great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, back one! Back! No, it's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're up. You're currently still constrained inside its body. The tautness of the rope around your waist has gone slack, so in a moment, you realize either your friends are dead, or they managed to break the rope. You would think that, if you weren't so full of anger and rage at being shot and squeezed and devoured by a giant crocodile. What are you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I reach the jug at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say you can take your action to reach into your Bag of Holding and pull it out, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought he had it out already. It was on his head, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, he had it out earlier. Have you had it on your head this whole time?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I had it tilted up so I could see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If that was the case, the sheer force of the creature biting you initially and throwing you onto the bank would've tossed that jug quite a ways away from you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then it wasn't there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was in my pocket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what I thought. So do you want to spend your action to rummage through the Bag of Holding and pull out the jar?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And that's my action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be your action, yes. You can use your bonus action to attack because you're in a frenzied rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, fuck it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're still raging, too, because I hit you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm like this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have disadvantage on your attacks. You can still attack him from the inside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I cast Enlarge on myself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try. Is that what you want to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll try that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your mind is suddenly clouded with the thought of, "Jug! I need to get the jug... No." You feel your body, your physical form begin to ripple and swell. You guys watch as the crocodile, now currently recovering from the blight-like withering of its form, suddenly its eyes go wide once more as its gullet begins to swell wider and wider. You hear this low (retching), like a cat coughing up a hairball slowed down, as you watch an enlarged Grog get immediately vomited up and out of the creature to its side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: His favored terrain is vomit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to do that, sir.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I get puked out. Can I use whatever movement speed I have left to drag the daisy chain with me away from the crocodile?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you rush away, he gets an attack of opportunity on you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah. It got separated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does have disadvantage because you shot it last turn. Which is good, because the second roll was a natural 20. That's a total of 20 to hit. What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so it just hits you with the bite.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I Cutting Words him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do have a reaction, so yes, you may.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I will Cutting Words him. I'll say: Mm-Grog (vocalizing) Grog (vocalizing). Yeah! It's supposed to distract him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's not inspiring somebody. It is intended to distract the opponent. And this crocodile, probably having a rather rough time in the early 2000s, manages to provide even more bile from its stomach at the sound of a rehashed Hanson song. Go ahead and make your roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do I roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You roll your inspiration die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's a d10.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: d10? Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you manage to get away, at that point, we'll say about that far. As you turn around, the daisy chain has not followed you. Glancing down, the rope that was once around your waist has snapped by the growth in size, and all the rest of the ropes have also been snapped. Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, you're out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. That ends your turn. It is now the croc's turn. It's going to make a bite attack right now. This is going to be at Percy, since you're right there in front of him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bring it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry. I won't sing Hanson again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage, that is a 23.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits you. All right, as the head turns back towards you, it opens to the side and tries to clamp on you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm using my new fancy counter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, your counter ring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so excited to take damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 34.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 34 points of piercing damage, and you are currently grappled and restrained.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grappled and restrained.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, he's in the crocodile's mouth now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your armor class?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! I mean, 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20, okay, so it still hits you. All right, so the stinger (whipcrack) grinds itself into your flesh, tears through the armor separation there, and you can feel pulsing. I need you to go ahead and make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because that's my strength.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you take 16 points of piercing damage from the actual stinger itself striking you. You now feel that pulse of venom through your body, and as it begins to swell through you, you feel all the colors and all the images of the landscape around you begin to shift and bubble and move.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're tripping, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know which way is up and down, and you are extremely frightened and confused.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're frightened? Oh no, it's a bad trip.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that mean I lose my turn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that ends the crocodile's turn, and it is now your turn. Currently, you cannot take reactions, and I need you to roll a d8 to see what you do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, it could be anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled a five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll of five. Okay. You take no action, and you use all of your movement to move in a random direction. You go into the river. You turn around and begin to flee. Looking ahead of you, you see what seems to be a moving sea of grass, and all of a sudden you feel your feet (splashing). The river begins to pull you away at the end of your turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Son of a bitch. Oh shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bye!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make another constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good. Okay. Oh, natural 20!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She turns back time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's nothing I can do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're restrained. You can attack. You can't move, and all your attacks have disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, but I've got Hex on him, so even if I hit him with a sword, it's an extra d6. I'm going to try and start hacking him to let me go. Ooh! Weird question. If I use the drop-it effect, the grit drop an item, can I get him to drop me, as an item?

lines.name: MATT
