lines.text: I don't think you count as an item, I'm sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sticking him in the jaw, I can't get him to? I can't make him roll to drop?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a massive muscle currently clamped on you, trying to swallow you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was hoping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. Sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, in that case, I'm going to grab my sword and start hacking at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so we'll say you use your bonus action to draw your weapon. It's right there by your side. You pull it out. Go ahead and make your attacks against the crocodile.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's a 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 just barely hits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. You had advantage on them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did I? No, I don't have advantage for these.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, technically it would have been the first attack since Pike's Guiding Bolt. Thank you for the reminder of that. So it would've been a normal attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was the first attack since her Guiding Bolt?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I thought I attacked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yours didn't have a spell attack, it just instantly hit and made a save. So technically, what was your first roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. The next roll wasn't a 20, so it doesn't matter, anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Guiding Bolt wears off. However, that did manage to get rid of the disadvantage on that one strike. Seeing the bright side of its face, you take your blade out and hack downward for the first hit, which does strike true across the side of its face. You can make your next two attacks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, in that case, natural 20. Oh, it has disadvantage, though, so it's still the 28.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, if I can be a stickler, I also Cutting Wordsed him, so that puts him at disadvantage on a save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On his next saving throw, but he's not making a saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a kangaroo court!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The next time he has a saving throw, I'll keep the disadvantage in mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you're in trouble, Samuel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, so that hit, and then for my last one... That's not bad. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, all three strikes hit. Go ahead and roll damage on all those.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I can get all my d8s. And then 3d6 for some necrotic damage. So that's 13 points of necrotic damage and 37 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [break]

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this for me? Motherfuckers!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're so low.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, god, that game again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog? It's all for Grog? Is it just for you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So on Vax's turn... Vax is going to go ahead and dart around this way, behind Garmelie, getting to where Trinket is flanking along the river bend there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, are we just right back in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he does pull out of the range of the tail, the croc can go ahead and make an attack of opportunity with the stinger out towards him behind. That is not going to hit, that is a natural four. That's going to be like a 16, so yeah. As it swings with its tail wide to Vax, Vax ducks beneath it, arms up to the side, leaps in the air and catches himself right on the edge of the bank. He looks over and notices you, running off to the side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me! Me, help me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Immediately decides to put his daggers back away, and then uses a dash action to dart over to the edge of the river where you are, and is going to reach out and try and grab your arms. You guys are reaching for each other right now. That is how it's going to go for this moment. That brings us to Garmelie, who now, free of the rope circumstance and the chaos around, looks and sees you out in the river, scoots around, goes out with, grabs your brother's arm and then reaches out towards your arm and chains his way towards you, putting his hand towards you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Garmelie's helping!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Garmelie!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Grab!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a sign he's going to turn on us at any moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He manages to hold in the moment, but doesn't actually get any ground on pulling you out of the river, so now it's just him and Vax holding you at the edge. The river's pulling you harder and harder, and you can feel the actual swell getting stronger, but they're still managing to keep you in place. That ends his turn. Pike, you're up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. How is the monster crocodile plant doing? Is he looking rough?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's looking hurt.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is he regenerating himself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've noticed each time it's had a moment to itself, its roots have dug in and it's pulled back into its form, yeah. It has been still regenerating every round, yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's bullshit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It really is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know what? I'm going to hold off on that then. No, you know what? I'm going to Flame Strike him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing on him?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just the old Flame Strike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. All righty. Where do you want that Flame Strike to land?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just on his whole body.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wherever you see it, onto the middle of its body.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, where do I want to see it? Maybe his torso area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where it won't hurt anybody else around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look over in the distance, unable to really see beyond the form of the creature, you bring the Flame Strike down onto its form. It's going to make a saving throw with disadvantage because of your Cutting Words, which is good because it rolled a 17 for the first one. And it rolled a 15 for the second one. No dex bonus for it because it's not very fast. Your DC is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, here's some more d6. Take them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you're up next.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much fire and divine damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's very pissed off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Monster!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that the end of your turn, Pike? Are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How's everybody doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a little iffy, but I'm okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're a little iffy? Yeah, I want to Healing Word Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the range on it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 60 feet? Yeah, you can get to him from there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. So you heal him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, so I'll heal him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're casting Healing Word at second level?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Roll the dice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is that? How many-- oh, she's rolling dice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 19. That's nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I don't know, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Real fast, Pike. That was 2d4 plus five?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, isn't it my spellcasting modifier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just add plus five.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so then it would be 13, because I rolled two fours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Scanlan, what are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a large creature? I know it's large, but how large?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be classified as a huge creature.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Well, then forget that. Okay, I'm going to Eyebite him with my eyes of craziness. Put up the hand cone, and I'm going to try to make him sick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so let's take its wisdom saving throw against your DC. That is a six with no modifier. It is certainly sickened, though its disadvantage has worn off, of course.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I won't really move, but I will inspire Grog, because he needs to hit something, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm telling you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And they kind of made me hard! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, staying where you are, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Staying where I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh! It's me! Oh dear god. Okay. I am going to do what worked really well last time, and I'm going to do a 4th-level Blight. And what I want to do is, I want to take my staff, because I'm near him, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I want to take my staff, and where Pike put that nice little crispy donut hole in the middle of him, I want to take my staff right in the middle and bring it down and cast Blight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you want to do this? (cheering and chanting "Keyleth")

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the coolest thing that's ever happened to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the phantom chanting in the back of your head. How do you want to do this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My ego loves this. Is Percy still in his mouth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy is still in its mouth, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to say: Stop putting foreign objects in your mouth!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you want the Blight spell to take hold in its body?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It takes hold? Okay. How about this? You know the petrified forests in Arizona? Can I petrify him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Percy! How's the weather up there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ow!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would be cheering for you if I wasn't drowning at this very moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On that note, too, I need you to make a strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not a saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, just a check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) You and Vax and Garmelie still hold your ground, but unfortunately, not a whole lot of physical strength in this daisy chain right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I ask Trinket to come up and help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's Trinket's strength bonus?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Four! He's stronger than me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whereas you began to pull them in towards the river, Trinket makes up the back end of it and manages to drag all of you out of the wake, onto the side. As you get up and cough out the water, Trinket comes up to you and nuzzles you on the side of your face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, buddy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (moans)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get up and hug Garmelie. What! You saved me. You're wonderful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What was I supposed to do, watch you drown? No! We're almost to the end of our agreement."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I tousle his hair. Good job, Keyleth!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How you doing, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grog, could you help with this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I get to chop down a tree, finally? (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I really wanted alligator boots, but I suppose that will do. Please help.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I get to chop him? I start chopping down the petrified alligator tree!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, catch him when he falls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket rushes up and looks up at you underneath with open jaws.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (heavy footsteps, whack) With one clean hit, the bloodaxe carves straight through its body, causing the upper part of the torso to slam into the ground with a big speed. Upon the impact, it rolls a few feet, taking Percy in its jaws.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, ow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do suffer two points of damage from it, but eventually you hit a point in the bank where the jaw cracks into a hundred pieces, and you tumble onto the ground and catch your breath, after being restrained for so long.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I stand up and kick one of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth wants to get down on the grass that she hurt, and I want to cast Druidcraft and heal it, and talk to the grass, and be like: It wasn't personal. I hope you know you were not the intended target, you just happened to be caught in the fray. It's okay. Don't be mad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you extend your fingers about you, you see small strands of green go (popping) and you hear a hundred soft voices go, "Eh."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like your enthusiasm, grass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. How are you doing over there, gnomesies?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on, you should get over here! No rush, but.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, there's a river.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't forget to loot the body?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's nothing to loot on the petrified alligator, is there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, there's an empty stomach, isn't there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's made of petrified wood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to stick my head in and see if there's anything in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The very tiny, pressed stomach interior of this creature, petrified as it is, it's like staring into one of those weird high school science room half-man organ presentation statues. You can see where the folds of the stomach lining are. There appear to be some remnants of bone, some entities that were partially digested, but nothing that catches your eye to be something worth pulling out of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just for fun, Grog, smash this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay! (whack)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is no more.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How was that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything exciting come out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Many small, petrified crocodile pieces.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (applause)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get a souvenir from the Feywild! That's all I wanted.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got two more rivers, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One more, technically. You guys have all made your way across. There's one last one that leads to the outskirts of the Shademirk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to keep perception check up to make sure we don't run into another one of those fuckers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Listen, hey, is anybody near death? I'm super big right now. How about I just throw everybody across the river?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I throw Pike across the river?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22 for perception.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait. I need you to smack me in the face first. (impact) I would like to rage! Natural 20.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to get in a ball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which you have disadvantage on. Hold on, because you took a point of exhaustion from frenzied raging during the battle. However, you do get advantage on strength checks while raging, so it's a singular roll, so the natural 20 stands. So as you pick Pike up, she smacks you in the face. The grin crawls across, and you (whoosh) lob her. She lands in the top of a tree. You see (cracking) in the bushes as a few leaves dangle down. You can see some gloppy black stuff out of the side, and you hear this muffled voice in the distance as Pike landed okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She's laughing. That was awesome!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I try and skip Vax across the river? (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax says, "I'd rather run." And he goes running forward and attempts to make a leap across the river. He leaps, makes it most of the way, catches his ankle on the edge, and begins to flutter backward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what you get, stupid!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't you save him? Aren't you on the other side?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm looking at the trees. I'm hanging out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. However, he does manage to right himself. He only got partially into the river and managed to pull his way out, so he's fine. Grog, who are you throwing next?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's next?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Percy's next! Can I granny shot this one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts) You lob him. It's enough to get you across, but the landing is not very graceful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I acrobatics check this to try and make the landing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Three-point landing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll be a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. You manage to use the actual momentum to go into a shoulder roll, stumble forward, and you come to a standing point. However, when you do, you realize you rolled through a bunch of slick, tar-like muck, and the side of your jacket is now seeping with it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was already covered in crocodile bile.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. You feel balanced.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is another layer of sadness.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's next?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll go next. But I want to bring out my broom and hold it in my hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the spirit of the Olympic games, can I shot put her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see Trinket come up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket goes into your necklace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm strong as fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's okay. That's a 28, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You actually catch yourself on the side of the tree, landing, and then leap off of it with the last bit of momentum, stepping gingerly on the tips of your feet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I clap from however far away I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear muffled clapping in the tree boughs ahead of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I fly up and I grab Pike down from the tree. Can I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's about 15 feet up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I fly 15 feet up and grab Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thanks! I didn't know how I was going to get down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you left?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to go with me as I jump across, or should I throw you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Piggy-back that shit, Keyleth!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wave my hands and say: I'll catch you, Kiki!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. You want to shot put this one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's going to be fast-pitch softball.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will receive that. Set!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hut!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts) With a big long toss, you make it most of the way over the water and begin to descend very close on the opposite side of the bank. Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Use your new dice!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, fuck that new dice. Nine. Not great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suffering 11 points of damage, and as Percy pulls you up, your entire front of your face and the little bit of hair in the crown is caked with this tar-like substance. Your nostrils are filled with it. You can't open your eyes. It tastes like IHOP. It's terrible.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And probably never will be.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There goes our IHOP sponsorship.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I gag a little, try to keep it down. Try to wash my face if I can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who's left? Garmelie?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Garmelie!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Garmelie's on the side. He goes, "Don't worry. You first."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess you got us all the way here, didn't you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Once he's across, our accord is complete."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah. No, totally. Come here, bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No!" Roll an attack. Well, technically, this is a grapple, so it's an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A 20. Total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! I don't have to go there! "I'm just going back the other way when we're done!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 20 again. 12 plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to the Shademirk. Good luck."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We made it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't want to see what happens at the end of the journey? You want to come with us, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The longer you stand still, the harder it gets "to escape the place you stood. And there's a lot of things that tend to live here, from what I've "heard, that wait for stillness as a means of attack. So keep moving."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What kinds of things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been something."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, before he goes, I want to give him a kiss on his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little kiss on the head, and he goes, "Well, at least it's been a pleasure travelling "with you, my lady." He takes your hand and does a little bow and (kiss) on the edge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As I was kissing him, can I give him a little pat down to make sure he didn't steal anything? (laughter and applause)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23? As you feel down, you feel this slight little bump inside of his fur, and you're afraid to touch it for fear of it being-- on the outside of his body! Not that you understand the physicality of the satyr, but still. It's hard and smooth. And appears to wiggle loosely when you touch it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, now I feel wrong saying I reach for it and try to see what it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you reach for it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're committed now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grasping onto it, you tug, and pull forth the small onyx mastiff that you had found earlier in the campground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Oh, that's right. I was holding this for you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much. You're so kind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The little black dog statue? Oh, I like that thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fantastic. Well, wish you all the best of luck. Stay alive."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait a minute. How do you plan on getting back across the rivers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see little sludgy footprints go off down the shore and around the bend.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bye!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cast Hunter's Mark really quick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, on him? Can I cast Hunter's Mark on him really quick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I cast Hunter's Mark on him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's already vanished.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry. I should've done it when I was kissing him, but I was distracted by feeling him up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It happens. All right, so what are you guys going to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Everything gets worse now, and we can't stop moving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should move until it's time to camp, and when we camp, we should camp in your palacious...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, in the mansion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got the mansion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank god.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we in the bog now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be the tangleward tip of it, the southern tip of the bog, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to test and see if we sink when we step on the bog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You step onto it, and your foot descends about three inches before it comes to a stop. (squelch)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It comes to a stop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But as you go to remove your foot, (sucking sound). It's very sticky. Effectively, you guys are at half movement moving through the bog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without Trace on us so that we can be stealthy. She doesn't have mist form, not until we rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could rest and learn mist, and we can mist across. That was what I was going to say.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it a treeline? Are we into trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ground floor and the base of most of the trees, and occasionally dripping from the top of the canopy itself is that black, sludge-like material.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's dripping from the trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's seemingly seeping from everything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have Land's Stride. Does that mean that this doesn't affect me? Or am I still slowed down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Read out Land's Stride to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Land's Stride isn't on any of my pieces of paper. Oh, wait. Here it is. Moving through non-magical difficult terrain costs you no movement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, yes, you can move at your normal pace. The rest of the party still has to stay slowed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to ride on the broom?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You sit on it, and then you fly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have to say a magical word?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll say it for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you have to tell them, and then they have to say it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try. It's up to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sit on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want front or back?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, sit on it! Front or back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll sit front, so you can have your arms around me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's sweet. (hacking spit)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys get up onto the broom, you release it from your grasp, and it goes (splat) onto the ground. Both of you guys sink about three or four inches into the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Say (hacking spit).

lines.name: ASHLEY, SAM
lines.text: (hacking spit).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It lifts up and pulls you guys slowly out of the sludge, (squelch) finally freeing yourself, and you're now hovering a very short distance above the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So at least you guys and me aren't slowed down, so that's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bye, guys!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: By the way, now that we're out of all this shit, can we look around and see if Ukurat has been peeping us this entire time?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're not in the forest anymore? This is bog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not considered forest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16 here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god! It's a 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys take a moment to look out in the distance, you're unable to really make any idea of a form or movement. Keyleth, you do see on the tree on the other bank, it looks a little thicker towards the top than you expect, and as you take a moment to glance, you can see a rather large creature drop down from the canopy onto the ground, and then slink behind it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So he's checking us out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's following you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So he's going to be able to get across all these rivers?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Apparently, he's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's pretty cool. He can jump really far.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give him a-- from a distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He shrinks sideways against the tree and is now barely visible, other than his furry chest that's now peeking out one side of the width of the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give him a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No reaction. Vax at this point is like, "So are we going to move on, then?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, but stealthily.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's do it." Make a stealth check, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without Trace on us, so we all got plus ten.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you get something good?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 32! Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a 30. I'm so quiet!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rolled a 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: and he's lumbering through it like a mammoth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're being sneaky, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is hot. It is muggy. There are heavy insects, large winged bugs (buzzing) through the air, and you knock them away. The bubbling of the ground itself is releasing sulfurous gas and various other chemicals into the air that are probably not healthy to breathe extensively. Many of you are having to cover your mouth to keep from coughing to break up your stealth capabilities.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to mask it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Put your mask on, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I keep an eye out for any movement ahead of us or around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. Yes?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I only stay enlarged for ten minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, it has now died down, and your form has shifted to its normal form.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I get to reroll my stealth check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys move forward and Vex is keeping watch, Vex, you see ahead of you about 80 yards, a large, stocky tree in the distance that has a gentle glow emanating from the trunk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Burn it down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That simple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like the tree we're looking for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to say at this distance. You would have to get closer to get a better look.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far off is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 80 yards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 80 yards. Fuck, I'm so scared of everything here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, what's between us and it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A series of trees and a few low areas of open sludge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it's a tree with a glowing bottom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks thicker than a lot of the other trees that you've seen in the area, and there's a dull glow at the base of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got a great idea. Let's send Trinket to go check out the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What the fuck? Why?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's a bear, and this is the woods.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is not the woods. This is a bog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If he goes unconscious, he does automatically come back. But no, that's only within 100 feet, that's not 80 yards. No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So take the broom back and fly 100 feet behind him. It's an idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we're only 80 yards out. Feet? 80 feet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll send Trinket out, and I'll sneak 100 feet behind him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (moans)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry, buddy. Okay. Don't get too far ahead of me. We're going to sneak ahead and check out this glowy tree. See it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. All right. Sneaky-sneaky.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Trinket manages to stalk forward. Make a stealth check for Trinket, without the plus ten, because Trinket was not around when you cast the spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's mean. What do I add?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His dexterity modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, okay. Six.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Total?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was a six?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He gets no pluses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. He's not very stealthy, that bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. He's a bear in armor. No. Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Trinket (squishy footsteps). You can hear the impact coming as each footfall hits the sludge. As you get closer towards it, keeping at bay, as best out of sight as possible. You see the tree, while it is thicker, it is not as high as the other trees. In fact, where there would be a top of a tree, it looks to be instead a tangled mass of branches that have been matted over and tied down to the top of where this tree ends.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I tell him to stop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket stops. You get a glance and the small glow is apparently a porthole or a window that is carved circular out from one side of the trunk of this tree. The glow is a dull reddish-orange, and it's flickering like firelight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's the Keebler elves. Kill them all!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I call him back. I feel like that's animals. That's not the tree we're looking for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is not the tree we're looking for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket backs up towards you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come back in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (squish, grunts) Dives into the necklace.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The whole time, us who were waiting have been do-si-do-ing around each other. We don't stop moving, so we're dancing in circles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, what are you doing, Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's a tree that looks like there's people living in it? It's a window looking out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems to have an interior and some sort of warm firelight from the inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's definitely a fairy tree. I'm going to stay clear. I'm going to go back. I'm going to go back to the party and tell them what I see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Vex returns from out of the shadows of the forest, no Trinket in tow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket died.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It doesn't look like the cancerous tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They may know where we want to go, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The pixies and fairies haven't been that nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not saying they're nice. I'm saying that maybe we need some new guidance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Look, maybe if you let me talk to them--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe Scanlan should go talk to them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could talk to them, but I want to know what they are first. We should do some recon and at least see what kind of creature they are. I can't just knock on a door. What if it's a crazy monster that pops its head out?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Then it eats you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You won't feel anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go up and talk, but aren't you curious?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, not really.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got your back. I'll go with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You'll both die, and then you'll know that the bear goes with you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a bonding trip.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want me to stay with you on the broom?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wait, you're taking the broom? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you care more about the broom than me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't answer that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've known me for years! You just met the broom!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe we can land there, and then we can send the broom back to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I need the broom to get away!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a fair point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In order to stay alive, you need to be near the broom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll keep an eye out, Vex. It'll be fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're not very intimidating.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do not like this plan at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are charming. You're both very charming, so be charming.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm not that charming.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're extremely charming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She is charming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I find her charming, too, but it doesn't mean that other people might.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What could possibly go wrong?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I go on the broom with you, Scanlan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No! Let the little bits go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're still doing a do-si-do, by the way, while we're having this conversation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Little bits go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Pikey. Let's go knock on the door and get killed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is me telling you that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think with this many witnesses, it's not a threat. It's a promise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a nearby tree that I can climb into?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's in the center of a small clearing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want a good vantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I get into a vantage point. I get up into a tree, and while they go do their recon, I want to cast Commune With Nature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So as you ascend the side of the nearest tree, and it resembles Atreyu climbing up the tree in the Swamp of Sadness, as it's these large gnarled branches and bits of muck and dust falling off the sides, and the oil slick that is surrounding the base makes it difficult to find your handholds, but you do eventually get your way up into the tree over the next five to ten minutes. You were going to cast Commune with Nature, you said?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What do you want to ask?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I sense a cancerous tree in the area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're asking this of the tree? Or is this the land around you, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm not asking the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Feeling out, you do not sense a cancerous tree, but you do sense the strengthening presence of the source of this entire swamp's perpetual destitution and slow decay, further to the northwest of this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Northwest. Okay. So I can safely assume that the tree that they're heading towards is not cancerous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we should call them back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm meditating. Then can I get a general lay of the land and sense running water and rivers, so we can avoid those?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. In feeling any source of bodies of water, you're too far from the Gilded Run to sense any of that, and there is no running water within the actual Shademirk. Everything is a very slow-rolling sludge from the direction that you initially sensed. It's this perpetual billowing of slow, crawling death. What little bit of running water you would sense is deep underground, and probably still in danger, over the next 50 years or so, of being corrupted itself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Okay. For my last question, can I get a sense on any big evil things that might want to kill us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everything. More specific that I won't screw it up. Are there Twinkies? Are there any more large crocodile dudes living under the-- I don't know. Any more large things living under the swamp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you do a sense for large, dangerous plant life entities like that crocodile.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just blanket it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you extend your presence, you get no images or any sense of creatures like that crocodile. However, you do sense a rather intense presence throughout this bog at certain places of other corrupted plant life entities.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does the tree in front of us count as a corrupted plant life entity? And none of the pixies that live in there are showing up on my radar as bad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. That's your final question. The spell fades. You climb your way back down out of the branches of the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This place sucks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you see?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so sad. The trees are so sad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anything useful?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're sad, or they're angry also?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A little bit of both.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we call the gnomes back?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The presence of the distortion and the corruption is getting stronger northeast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Then we should all go. We shouldn't just send the little bits in there, we should all go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to fight anymore before we get to whatever it is that we're getting to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have the gnomes already been set on their path at this time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're already cruising.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? Who said that? What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Attack the tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm getting mixed messages.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Scanlan, I'm a little nervous about these ropes. What if they're trying to catch us or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How many windows are there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One from what you can see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just one window?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think Vex might be right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come back? Should we do a fly by the window to see what's inside?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't even fly close to the tree. I have really bad feelings about this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fly by the window and peek in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fucking shit mother bitch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Using our expert flying skills, we're going to fly by the window and do one of these, and check out the Berenstain Bears and then run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not good. Eight.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait. Okay. I think I just have so much mud in my eye I don't see anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You don't pick up a lot of detail, but as you come up over the top, looking on the inside, it looks to be rather comfortable, surprisingly. It's a small home. There's a table, and there's a small hearth. There appears to be what looks to be a shelf of some kind, ramshackle, maybe, but still functional, with books pressed into it. You can see a number of small baskets hanging from the ceiling, containing various roots and other pieces of plant matter that are gathered and bundled together. You can see there is a fireplace by the hearth. There is also a series of drying animal carcasses hung in the corner that are all stripped, and they're being aired out in that space. You also see what looks to be a large chair that is facing the hearth, slightly away from you, and a small end table next to it that contains a little teacup and a little tea set.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They look nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What size person is the chair for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Small?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, the chair is pretty large. It's tall. The tea set is small. And as you're making a look, you see one large crooked hand reach out from behind the chair with impossibly long fingers with hooked nails reach over. You can see what looks like dried wrappings hanging from parts of its wrist and elbow as it reaches over and wraps its gnarled fingers around this tiny teacup and pull it back behind the chair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you describe this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't. I see it and I turn around and I say: Pike, let's get out of here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you hear a snap sound, and next to you, you hear this (creak) as a little bit of light peeks out to your left. A door has slowly opened on the side of the tree trunk.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Guys? Guys!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Please fly fucking back right now! Please!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do you want to do, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We bolt. We bolt for it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (hacking spit)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (hacking spit) And start flying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Flying where?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Back to our friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys turn and begin making your way back towards the party, and the broom slows.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How far away is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It comes to a stop and then drops out from under you both (squish) into the sludge.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. That's okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I grab Pike, and we both go invisible.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I pick up the broom before we go invisible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and you're casting Invisibility?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Invisibility. I guess at one level higher, right? Is that what I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe that's what you do to get more of that. Making sure real fast, so we don't mess this up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Level three Invisibility.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both turn invisible, her clutching the broom.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're both invisible now. You're clutching the broom.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're invisible and the broom is invisible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go (surprised shriek).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We start tip-toeing out, I suppose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch them vanish ahead of you. A few moments pass, and you guys end up making your way back to the group, and you see the (squish) footfalls of both of your tiny gnome friends.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am watching that hag through my scope with everything I've got.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From your perspective, you can't really see anything through the window. You're just going off of what they've told you, which has been very little. You're looking into the side of the window, and all you see is a little bit of flicker of firelight. That's it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I go up to Vex and I give her her broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (relieved noises) (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) What did you find?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's a woman. It looked like it was really nice, and then there was this really cute tea set, and then this crazy hand came out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That sounds terrible.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She looks really scary.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was she really tall? Do you know if she was tall?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, anybody's tall to us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is true.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, she was very large.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Super important question: Did they see you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think probably.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, the broom stopped flying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you saying we should hide, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering and laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you, Matt, for saving a marriage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that was fun. Thank you guys so much for joining us for this. We're going to go ahead and take a few minutes here and do a short Q and A with those of you guys we have here in the stage before we need to clean up here, and we'll do the meet and greet upstairs. That being the case, do we have a set-up over there with the microphone to ask questions?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have we stopped broadcasting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dude, you have to say good-bye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. Well, before we begin this Q and A, I want to thank you all for watching and tuning in. Thank you all so much. We'll be back next week, Thursday at our regular time slot and schedule. Thank you for joining us this Saturday, and yeah. Is it Thursday yet?
